segments.text: I see the woman standing by the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she just keeps drying that plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children behind her, reaching for cookies like they’re getting away with something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a wobbly stool, and I can’t believe the woman hasn’t noticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for a cookie, completely ignoring the fact that her brother might fall any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole kitchen is about to turn into chaos, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge, and it’s only a matter of time before someone slips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything seems when there’s so much going wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and the kids are going to get in so much trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR
